SEARCH
Package Game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game.Game
public class Game extends Object
The `Game` class represents a game of Cards Against Mindera. It manages game state, players, card decks, rounds, and scoring.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(ClientConnectionHandler owner, int maxNumOfPlayers, String name) throws IOException
      Creates a new game with the specified owner, maximum number of players, and name.
      Parameters:
      owner - The owner of the game.
      maxNumOfPlayers - The maximum number of players allowed in the game.
      name - The name of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

  • Method Details

    • incrementPlayedCardsCounter

      public void incrementPlayedCardsCounter()
      Increment the played cards counter.

    • allPlayersPlayedCards

      public boolean allPlayersPlayedCards()
      Check if all players have played their cards for the current round.
      Returns:
      true if all players have played, false otherwise

    • checkAllPlayersInGame

      public boolean checkAllPlayersInGame(Game game)
      Checks if all players have joined the game, updates the game state accordingly, and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      game - The game to check.
      Returns:
      True if all players have joined, false otherwise.

    • announceVoteResult

      public void announceVoteResult(String card, String name) throws IOException
      Announces the result of the vote for a specific card in the game.
      Parameters:
      card - The winning card.
      name - The name of the winning player.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • submitCard

      public void submitCard(String card, ClientConnectionHandler player)
      Submits a card for a specific player in the game.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to be submitted.
      player - The player submitting the card.

    • getSubmittingPlayer

      public ClientConnectionHandler getSubmittingPlayer(String card)
      Retrieves the player who submitted a specific card.
      Parameters:
      card - The card for which to retrieve the submitting player.
      Returns:
      The submitting player or null if the card is not found.

    • checkWinner

      public void checkWinner()
      Checks for a winner by counting the number of players with an empty card hand. If the count equals the maximum number of players, it indicates that all players have won.

    • announceBigWinner

      public void announceBigWinner()
      Announces the big winner of the game by checking each player's score. If a player's score matches the predefined scoreToWin, they are declared the winner. The game state is updated to indicate that the game is over if a winner is found.

    • getRunningGames

      public static String getRunningGames() throws IOException
      Retrieves a formatted string containing information about all running games. Each line in the output represents a game and includes details such as the name, the maximum number of players, the number of players in the game, available free spots, and the name of the player who started the game.
      Returns:
      A string containing information about all running games.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while retrieving game information.

    • getGameByName

      public static Game getGameByName(String name)
      Retrieves a game based on its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the game.
      Returns:
      The game with the specified name, or null if not found.

    • startGame

      public void startGame(Game game) throws InterruptedException, IOException
      Initiates the start of a game, including announcements and setup procedures.
      Parameters:
      game - The game to start.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted during execution.
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • announceStartOfNewRound

      public void announceStartOfNewRound() throws IOException
      Announces the start of a new round, resets game-related counters, and provides information to players.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the announcement.

    • join

      public void join(ClientConnectionHandler clientConnectionHandler) throws IOException
      Allows a player to join the game and sends a corresponding message.
      Parameters:
      clientConnectionHandler - The connection handler of the joining player.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while sending the join message.

    • initializeWhiteDeck

      public List<String> initializeWhiteDeck() throws IOException
      Initializes the white deck of cards by reading content from a file.
      Returns:
      The list of strings representing the white deck.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during deck initialization.

    • initializeBlackDeck

      public List<String> initializeBlackDeck() throws IOException
      Initializes the black deck of cards by reading content from a file.
      Returns:
      The list of strings representing the black deck.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during deck initialization.

    • allPlayersVoted

      public boolean allPlayersVoted()
      Checks if all players in the game have voted.
      Returns:
      True if all players have voted, false otherwise.

    • handleVotingResult

      public void handleVotingResult() throws IOException
      Handles the result of the voting phase, determines the winner, and initiates the next round.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during result announcement.

    • startVotingPhase

      public void startVotingPhase(ClientConnectionHandler clientConnectionHandler) throws IOException
      Initiates the voting phase by sending relevant instructions and card information to players.
      Parameters:
      clientConnectionHandler - The connection handler of the player initiating the voting phase.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the announcement.

    • getWhiteDeck

      public List<String> getWhiteDeck()
      Retrieves the white deck of cards.
      Returns:
      The white deck of cards.

    • setCardsInGame

      public void setCardsInGame(String card)
      Adds a card to the list of cards in the current game.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to be added.

    • setPlayedCardsCounter

      public void setPlayedCardsCounter(int playedCardsCounter)
      Sets the counter for the number of played cards in the current round.
      Parameters:
      playedCardsCounter - The new value for the played cards counter.
